title: [ğŸ“„ï¸ Evaluation API The Evaluation API is the primary component of OpenFeature that application authors interact with.](/docs/reference/concepts/evaluation-api)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ Providers Providers are responsible for performing flag evaluations.](/docs/reference/concepts/provider)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ Evaluation Context The evaluation context is a container for arbitrary contextual data that can be used as a basis for dynamic evaluation.](/docs/reference/concepts/evaluation-context)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ Hooks Hooks are a mechanism that allow for the addition of arbitrary behavior at well-defined points of the flag evaluation life-cycle.](/docs/reference/concepts/hooks)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ Events Events enable the ability to react to state changes in the provider or underlying flag management system.](/docs/reference/concepts/events)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ SDK Paradigms OpenFeature SDKs come in two "flavors"; those intended for use in server applications and those intended for use in client applications.](/docs/reference/concepts/sdk-paradigms)## [ğŸ“„ï¸ Tracking Tracking in OpenFeature is the process of associating metrics or KPIs with feature flag evaluation contexts.](/docs/reference/concepts/tracking)
